name: Marco Moriero
subtitle: Executive Finance Director, Italy at Gilead Sciences
about: International Finance professional with broad experience in the Healthcare industry.Proven leadership in multiple areas including Controllership, Tax, FP&A, as well as Commercial and General Management roles.Strongly oriented to partner with Executives and Senior Business leaders, had a solid track record of successful Sales growth initiatives and profit enhancement projects.Track record in the areas of people management, talent development and organizational design, specifically during periods of continuous change and transformation.Deep experience in managing cross-functional teams, led successful post-acquisition integration projects atPan-European level.
experiences: Country Director, Restorative Therapies Group, Italy
CFO, Sr Finance Director, Medtronic Italia S.p.a., amministratore delegato

Head of Finance and Business Partner to the Regional VP of Medtronic Italy.
Total annual sales: $900M.

Leads Accounting & Control, Tax, Credit Collection and Financial Planning & Analysis.
Supervises Pricing (including Tender office), IT, Sourcing and Facilities.
Sr Finance Director, AST & ET Europe, and Area Controller

Finance Business Partner to the Europe VP of Advanced Surgical Technologies.

Full P&L responsibility for Advanced Surgical Technologies and Early Technologies businesses in Europe (Annual Sales: $1.1B).

Project leader for the post-acquisition integration of Given Imaging in Europe (Go-live date: August 1st, 2014).
Had the full responsibility for Income Statement and Balance Sheet of Ge Medical Systems Italia S.p.a. and Ge Medical Systems Hellas A.E.E..
Service Financial Analyst, Italy, Israel, Turkey & Greece

DO YOU KNOW WHO YOU ARE TALKING TO? We are used to see arrogant people use their position to bully and harass other people, and impose their will and "given-rights". It is ugly and disrespectful. And every single one of us have already witnessed a situation like this, right? During the Australian Open last week, before entering the locker room, Roger Federer was stopped by a staff member for not wearing his badge. Yes, Roger Federer. The 20-time Grand Slam winner Roger Federer. Yes, the 310-week leading ATP Ranking Roger Federer. The best tennis player of all times.After being stopped, RF just acted like you would expect him to act. The superstar just stopped, and waited for his crew to catch up with him and flash his badge to the staff member. No bullying, no harassment, no disrespect, no "do you know who you are talking to". And we thought we could only learn from him playing on the court. hashtag#tennis hashtag#respect
How exciting to be on stage and celebrate Medtronic achievements!
